page.title: 15GENERAL HEALTH AND DOCTORS.
page.content: In Britain there is a National Health System{(NHS)}which provides a subsidised medical service for every_ one.This system runs on a percentage of tax,which the common tax_payer contributes.Treatment,e.g.dental,and prescriptions are paid for by the NHS until the person reaches 18.Norwich is the Authority responsible for the Southwold and Reydon area. { {GENERAL HEALTH.} There are three doctors responsible for Southwold,who are available full time.There is a local hospital in Southwold that caters mainly for the geriatric patients,but also has a physio-therapy unit for out-patients as well as residents.The hospital can accommodate{17}patients.The patients who need hospital care in the area go to the two nearest hospitals.
